title: How to Recover and Secure a Hacked Hotmail Account

steps.title: Scan your device for viruses first.
steps.content: Scan your device for viruses first. Before you try to regain access to your account, scan your device for viruses and malware. If your computer has a malware infection, changing your password won't do much. You can scan for viruses on your Windows or Mac computer , iPhone , and Android .

steps.title: Go to the Outlook website.
steps.content: Go to the Outlook website . If the hacker has changed your password and locked you out of your account, you'll need to reset your password to regain access. To reset your password, you must have a recovery email account, and be able to access that email address. If you can still log in to your Outlook/Hotmail/Live account, you can change the password instead of going through the reset process. Just log in to your account, click your profile photo, and go to My Microsoft account > Security > Change password to do so.

steps.title: Enter your email address and click Next.
steps.content: Enter your email address and click Next . This is the blue button.

steps.title: Click Forgot password?.
steps.content: Click Forgot password? . This is underneath the password field. If you have a hard time remembering all your passwords, Oppido recommends using a password manager like LastPass or 1Pass. [1] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019. Once you save all your passwords in your password manager, the only password you'll need to remember is the master password for your password manager. [2] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019.

steps.title: Click the bubble for your recovery email.
steps.content: Click the bubble for your recovery email. It will be censored aside from two letters and the domain. The steps may vary slightly depending on your browser. Select the option most similar to entering your recovery email. If you don't have a recovery email linked to your account, you'll be asked to enter the email address you want to access and a separate email address where you can be reached.

steps.title: Type in your recovery email.
steps.content: Type in your recovery email. To send the recovery code, you'll need to enter the recovery email address correctly.

steps.title: Click Get code.
steps.content: Click Get code . This is the blue button. The recovery code will be sent to the email; be sure to check for any new emails. On some browsers, you may need to click Next or a similar option instead.

steps.title: Enter the recovery code.
steps.content: Enter the recovery code. If you don't see the email, check your spam or junk folders.

steps.title: Enter a new password.
steps.content: Enter a new password. strong password with a mix of capital and lower-case letters, numbers, and symbols. Once you're logged into your account, you'll be prompted to enter a new password. Make sure to use a password you haven't used before. When your new password is set, check your security settings to add two-factor authentication and update your recovery email if needed. Oppido explains that if your account was hacked, the hacker might have found your password online due to a data breach. [3] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019. If you use the same username and password for other accounts, such as Steam, Gmail, or any other service, the hacker may also be able to access those accounts. "When in doubt, change your passwords," Oppido says. [4] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019. Oppido also warns against reusing a compromised username and password for your other accounts, as this could make it easy for hackers to access your new account. [5] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019.

steps.title: Log into the Outlook Security page.
steps.content: Log into the Outlook Security page . Two-step verification adds a second layer of security to your account, which makes it harder for hackers to access your account, even if they have your password. Enter your email address and password. You should automatically be directed to the Security options.

steps.title: Click Turn on next to "Two-step verification".
steps.content: Click Turn on next to "Two-step verification". This is under the Additional security header.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . This will open the setup page.

steps.title: Select an authentication method.
steps.content: Select an authentication method. You can use another email address, a phone number, or an authenticator app .

steps.title: Verify the method.
steps.content: Verify the method. Depending on the previous choice, you'll need to input a code or scan a QR code on your screen. Once you confirm the device, your account will send you a code each time you want to log in, which you'll need to enter to complete the process.

steps.title: Log into the Outlook Security page.
steps.content: Log into the Outlook Security page . Enter your email address and password. You should automatically be directed to the Security options.

steps.title: Click Add a new way to sign in or verify.
steps.content: Click Add a new way to sign in or verify . This is below the Ways to prove who you are header. If you want to remove an existing recovery email, click it underneath the header. Then, click Remove .

steps.title: Click Email a code.
steps.content: Click Email a code . This is the third option.

steps.title: Enter the email and click Next.
steps.content: Enter the email and click Next . Make sure this is an email you can get into.

steps.title: Enter the verification code.
steps.content: Enter the verification code. A code will be sent to the recovery email. Once you verify the code, it will be linked to your account.

steps.title: Log into the Outlook website.
steps.content: Log into the Outlook website . Use this method if your language settings were changed while your account was compromised.

steps.title: Click the cog icon.
steps.content: Click the cog icon. This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Click General.
steps.content: Click General . You can find this tab in the left panel. If it's not in English, look for the cog icon between the person icon and the mail icon.

steps.title: Click Language and time.
steps.content: Click Language and time . This is the first option in the middle panel.

steps.title: Select the "Language" drop-down menu and choose a new language.
steps.content: Select the "Language" drop-down menu and choose a new language. This is the first box.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This will apply your changes.

steps.title: Log into the Outlook website.
steps.content: Log into the Outlook website . If you think some of your mail has been deleted when your account was compromised, it may be recoverable.

steps.title: Click Deleted Items.
steps.content: Click Deleted Items . This is in the left panel, underneath Sent Items . Deleted items may be recovered if it's within 30 days.

steps.title: Click Recover items deleted from this folder.
steps.content: Click Recover items deleted from this folder . You'll see the number of recoverable items in parentheses.

steps.title: Click the emails you want to recover.
steps.content: Click the emails you want to recover. If you want to recover all emails, check the box near Recoverable Items .

steps.title: Click Restore.
steps.content: Click Restore . This is in the top toolbar, next to Empty folder . The deleted emails will be restored to your main inbox.
